avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche danger is considerable above the tree line (level 3), below it is low. In particular, older snowdrift accumulations, but also bonded snow in all aspects due to warming, can be triggered as medium slab avalanches in many places, especially behind ridgelines, terrain edges and in gullies and bowls, even under slight additional load.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Significant avalanche danger in all aspects! Even a single person can trigger a slab avalanche!

snowpackStructure.comment: Up to 60 cm of new fallen snow has fallen since Thursday. The snow has been transported to the eastern sectors by stormy westerly to north-westerly winds over a large area, but locally all directions and also forest aisles below the tree line may be affected. As a result of the warming, a bound snow layer will also develop in places where there was previously unbound powder. Weak layers are mainly found between drift and new fallen snow and the old snowpack (unstable layer of faceted crystals). In the foundation of the snow cover, kinetic metamorphism (floating snow) weakens the stability.

tendency.highlights: Wednesday will be mild and mostly sunny. Although the warming may lead to some spontaneous avalanches, the avalanche danger is slowly decreasing.

weatherForecast.comment:
In the first half of the night, the snowfall level rises from 1200 m to 1500 m, while it is still snowing or raining at low altitudes. However, the snowfall will subside everywhere around midnight. As a result, the clouds will become softer, with only thin, high veil clouds passing by. And so it is very sunny and dry for most of the day.
The temperature at an altitude of 2000 metres will be a mild 0 to +2 degrees.  A brisk wind from the west.

avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche danger is moderate above the tree line (level 2) and low below.  In particular, older snowdrift accumulations, but also bonded snow in all aspects can be triggered as a small to medium slab avalanche in some places, especially behind ridgelines, terrain edges and in gullies and bowls, even with a small additional load.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Moderate avalanche danger above the tree line. Even a single person can trigger a slab avalanche!

snowpackStructure.comment: Up to 30 cm of new fallen snow has fallen since Thursday. The snow has been transported to the eastern sectors by stormy westerly to north-westerly winds on a large scale, but all directions can be affected locally. Due to the warming, a bound snow layer is also developing in places where there was previously unbound powder. Weak layers are mainly found between drift and new fallen snow and the old snowpack (unstable layer of faceted crystals). In the foundation of the snow cover, kinetic metamorphism (floating snow) weakens the stability.

tendency.highlights: Wednesday will be mild and mostly sunny. Although the warming may lead to some spontaneous avalanches, the avalanche danger is slowly decreasing.

weatherForecast.comment:
It will remain mostly clear on Monday night, with clouds gathering from the west in the morning. A warm front will bring some snowfall to the northern side of the Alps from midday. The frost will weaken significantly and the snowfall level will rise to 1400 metres by the evening.
The temperature will rise from -10 degrees in the morning to -1 degrees in the evening. The wind is still blowing strongly from the north-west.

avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche danger is low. However, older snowdrift accumulations in gullies and bowls and behind broad ridges and ridgelines above the tree line can occasionally be triggered as small slab avalanches.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Low avalanche danger, but isolated avalanche prone locations!

snowpackStructure.comment: Snowdrift accumulations often lie on faceted crystals or surface hoar, which can act as a weak layer. However, the warming has a stabilising effect on this weak layer.  Windward terrain is usually blown off and almost snow-free.

tendency.highlights: Wednesday will be mild and mostly sunny. The avalanche risk remains low.

weatherForecast.comment:
During the first half of the night, the snowfall level will rise from 900 m to 1400 m, while it will snow a little in the eastern mountain groups or rain at low altitudes. On the Wechsel, dense residual clouds will persist until midday. In the western peripheral mountains, the sky will be largely clear on Tuesday, with only thin, high veil clouds passing by.
The temperature at an altitude of 2000 metres will be a mild 0 to +3 degrees.  A strong north-westerly wind will blow in the eastern mountain ranges.

ALBINA.generalHeadline: Caution in the high altitudes!  Still considerable avalanche danger in places!
